title: Universal Blessing
shortSummary: Psalm 67 is a joyful prayer asking for God's mercy and blessing so that His ways and salvation would be known throughout the earth. It emphasizes the global praise of God, the righteous judgment He administers, and the resulting blessing and reverence from all nations. This psalm highlights God's desire for all peoples to recognize His sovereignty and goodness.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, traditionally attributed to David

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, traditionally King David, who leads the people in prayer and praise to God.

keyCharacters.name: The Nations
keyCharacters.description: Representing all peoples of the earth who are called to know, praise, and fear God.

definitions.definition: A liturgical or musical pause or interlude, possibly indicating a moment for reflection.
To confer favor, protection, or prosperity by divine power.

definitions.term: Cause his face to shine upon us
definitions.definition: An expression meaning to show favor and approval from God.
Refers to God's salvation and deliverance, encompassing spiritual and physical well-being.

outline.heading: Prayer for God's Mercy and Blessing
outline.description: The psalmist opens with a heartfelt plea for God's mercy and blessing, asking that His favor be evident to His people.

outline.heading: Purpose of God's Blessing: Universal Knowledge
outline.description: God’s blessing is requested so that His ways and salvation will be known throughout the earth, emphasizing the global scope of His redemptive plan.

outline.heading: Call for Universal Praise
outline.description: A repeated exhortation for all peoples to praise God, highlighting the inclusive nature of worship and the joy it brings to the nations.

outline.heading: God’s Righteous Judgment and Blessing
outline.description: The psalmist affirms God's righteous governance over the nations and the resulting blessings upon the earth, leading to reverence for God by all peoples.

application: Seek God's mercy and blessing daily, recognizing that His favor enables us to live fruitful lives for His glory.
Pray for the spread of the gospel so that all nations may come to know and praise God.
Respond to God's righteous judgment with obedience and trust, knowing He governs all with justice.
Live in a way that reflects God's blessing, encouraging others to fear and honor Him.

keyVerses.text: God be merciful unto us, and bless us; and cause his face to shine upon us; Selah.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone of the psalm as a prayer for God’s favor and presence, foundational for blessing and worship.

keyVerses.text: That thy way may be known upon earth, thy saving health among all nations.
keyVerses.significance: It reveals the purpose of blessing: the worldwide knowledge of God's salvation.

keyVerses.text: O let the nations be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge the people righteously, and govern the nations upon earth. Selah.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's righteous judgment and the joy it brings to the nations under His rule.

keyVerses.text: God shall bless us; and all the ends of the earth shall fear him.
keyVerses.significance: It concludes with the promise that God's blessing will lead to reverence from all peoples, underscoring His universal sovereignty.
